Dear Sir*
We are requesting authorization from Charles Scribner's Sons to use a
pom by E. A* Robinson, "Richard Cory", for which we understand you hold
the copyright.
Permission to use these materials is being sought by the H.A.E.B. in
connection with an arrangement we have with the Voice of America to develop
an English through Poetry series. The 13 ccaumentaries for those programs
are being written by Professor M. L. Rosenthal of New York University. She
Voice of America, in turn, working closely with Professor Rosenthal, will
produce 13 quarter-hour radio scripts on the basis of these commentaries.
The radio programs themselves are intended for broadcast to listeners
overseas, and are being designed to appeal to the listeners interest in
poetry in the English language*
In each script the poem win be xadd in its entirety, and the listeners
will also be invited to read the lines aloud in appropriate units after
the radio speaker.
Permission is sought both for the broadcast by the Voice at America to overÂ¬
seas countries and for broadcast in countries where local radio stations
may receive the taped programs through the United States Information Agency.
Permission is also sought for publication of the poems that might be
published in any given country (with the aid or supervision of U.S.I.A.),
and distributed free or at cost to radio listeners. Permission is also
sought for eventual publication of the materials in a similar study booklet
to be produced by U.S.I.A. for gratis distribution to overseas listeners
who request such booklets.
We hope we will hear from you shortly and that authorization to use this
poem in the manner which we have outlined will be forthcoming. If you would
like to have additional information about the use to which these poems will
be put, may I suggest that you contact Bp. Robert Goodell, Chief, Radio
Bnglish~!Teaching Branch, Voice of America, Washington, D.C., Phone WO 3-6378.
Sincerely,
